com.jgaap.backend
Class API

java.lang.Object
  com.jgaap.backend.API

public class API
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a simple interface into jgaap for use in other software packages and for development of any human interfaces. For examples of how to use the API class see the com.jgaap.ui package for a GUI example or the com.jgaap.backend.CLI class for a command line example

Since:
5.0.0
Author:
Michael Ryan

addDocument

public Document addDocument(java.lang.String filepath,
                            java.lang.String author,
                            java.lang.String title)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
This allows for the addition of documents to the system. Both Training (known) and Sample (unknown) documents must be provided before runing an experiment. Training Documents are added by providing an author(tag) for them. Sample documents are added when no auythor(tag) is given.

Parameters:
filepath - - the system file path or URL to a document
author - - the author of this document or the tag being applied to this document, if null or the empty string this document is considered unknown and is one of those classified
title - - Some means of identifying the document, if null or the empty string are provided a title will be generated from the file name
Returns:
- a reference to the document generated
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - if there is a problem loading the document from file web or parsing file format

addDocument

public Document addDocument(Document document)
Adds a previously generated document to the jgaap system.

Parameters:
document - - a file that has already been loaded as a Document
Returns:
- a refence to the document generated

removeDocument

public java.lang.Boolean removeDocument(Document document)
Removes a document from the system.

Parameters:
document - - a reference to the document that is to be removed
Returns:
- true on success false on failure

removeAllDocuments

public void removeAllDocuments()
Removes all documents loaded into the system.

Returns:

addAnalysisDriver

public AnalysisDriver addAnalysisDriver(java.lang.String action)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Add an AnalysisDriver to the system as referenced by the action. NOTE! for legacy purposes this methods also accepts actions that reference DistanceFunctions it will use the supplied distance function along with the NeighborAnalysisDriver NearestNeighborDriver which had been the only NeighbotAnalysisDriver prior to version 5.0 !!!WARNING!!! There are no guarantees that this functionality will remain in future releases please use addDistanceFunction

Parameters:
action - - the unique identifier for a AnalysisDriver (alternately a DistanceFunction)
Returns:
- a reference to the generated Analysis Driver
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - If the AnalysisDriver cannot be found or if it cannot be instanced

removeAnalysisDriver

public java.lang.Boolean removeAnalysisDriver(AnalysisDriver analysisDriver)
Removed the passed AnalysisDriver from the system

Parameters:
analysisDriver - - reference to the AnalysisDriver to be removed
Returns:
True if success false if failure

removeAllAnalysisDrivers

public void removeAllAnalysisDrivers()
Removes all AnalysisDrivers from the system

addDistanceFunction

public DistanceFunction addDistanceFunction(java.lang.String action,
                                            AnalysisDriver analysisDriver)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a DistanceFunction to the AnalysisDriver supplied. Only AnalysisDrivers that extend the NeighborAnalysisDriver can be used

Parameters:
action - - unique identifier for the DistanceFunction you want to add
analysisDriver - - a reference to the AnalysisDriver you want the distance added to
Returns:
- a reference to the generated DistanceFunction
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - if the AnalysisDriver does not extend NeighborAnalysisDriver if the DistanceFunction cannot be found if the DistanceFunction cannot be instanced

getAnalysisDrivers

public java.util.List<AnalysisDriver> getAnalysisDrivers()
Get a List of All AnalysisDrivers currently loaded on the system

Returns:
List of All AnalysisDrivers

getLanguage

public Language getLanguage()

setLanguage

public Language setLanguage(java.lang.String action)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Set the Language that JGAAP will operate in. This restricts what methods are available, changes the charset that is expected when reading files, and will add any pre-processing that is needed

Parameters:
action - - the Language to operate under
Returns:
- a Reference to the language object selected
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - if the language cannot be found or cannot be instanced

execute

public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Exception
Preforms the canonicize eventify cull and analyze methods since a strict order has to be enforced when using them

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
